STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 28, 2021
Carey Adrianse
Wexford/Missaukee County DHHS
10641 W Watergate
Cadillac, MI 49601
RE: License #: CP830201508
Wexford/Missaukee County DHHS
10641 W Watergate
Cadillac, MI 49601-0309
Dear Ms. Adrianse:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/15/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP (Modified Implementation Sustainability and Exit Plan). The corrective action plan
is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please submit this required Corrective Action Plan to Claudia Triestram via email at
triestramc@michigan.gov.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact if you have any
questions, Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(a) A summary of the services provided during care up to the
time of the change in placement and the needs that remain to
be met.
Two of 2 closed foster care files reviewed did not have a summary of the services
and the needs that remain to be met.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(b) Provision for any continuing services.
Two of 2 closed foster care files reviewed did not have provision for any continuing
services.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Please note that there are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was not required.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required
4

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period which was approved on 12/17/2020 with
noncompliance’s as follows:
CPA418(2)(b) Timeliness of Updated Service Plans
MISEP 6.49 Medical Passports
MISEP 3.33 Signing Service Plans
FOM 722-06H Timely Entry into MiSACWIS
FOM 722-03E Placement Exceptions and Approvals
There were no repeat violations.
VII. CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR ASSESSMENT
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed on 09/10/2021. It showed a
thorough review of foster care services files and adoption files and a corrective
action plan to resolve what she had found.
Interviews
The supervisor and foster care workers interviewed felt supported and are provided
the tools they need to perform their role.
VIII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert: The DCWL Analyst reported that a foster parent had moved her
bedroom to a basement room in violation of rule:
R 400.9306 Bedrooms. Rule 306.
(1) A foster parent shall ensure that bedrooms comply with all of the following
(f) Have at least 1 outside window that complies with all of the following provisions:
(i) Is accessible to children and caregivers.
(ii) Can be readily opened from the inside of the room.
(iii) Is of sufficient size and design to allow for the evacuation of children and
caregivers.
Resolution: The agency’s licensing worker reported to this consultant that the foster
parent has moved back to her upstairs bedroom out of the basement. The beds
were taken down and moved. There were pictures provided for verification and are
in MiSACWIS under foster home license number CF830288630. A special
evaluation was opened by the agency on 08/27/2021. The agency is currently doing
a special evaluation and also in process of renewing the foster home license.
5

IX. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
September 20, 2021
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 23, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
